title: Gilles de Rais
summary: Gilles de Rais (date of birth unknown, not earlier than 1405 – 26 October 1440),[1] Baron de Rais (French: [də ʁɛ]), was a knight and lord from Brittany, Anjou and Poitou,[2] a leader in the French army, and a companion-in-arms of Joan of Arc. He is best known for his reputation and later conviction as a confessed serial killer of children.
